reviewText: If you like Bruce Boxleitner - you'll love the Scarecrow and Mrs. King series.  I watched it in the 80's on TV and am enjoying it again 25 years later.
This was one of my favorite series when I was growing up and it was still just as enteresting today

I HAVE SOME OF THE EPISOPES ON VHS AND AND WAITING FOR THE DVD SO THAT I CAN WATCH THEM OVER AGAIN. I HAVE WATCHED THIS SHOW WHEN I HAVE THE CHANCE TO WATCH. I AM SURE THAT WITH THE COMEDY AND SERIOUS NATURE OF THE SHOW WHO EVER WATCHES THIS WILL LOVE IT, BUT DON'T TAKE MY WORD FOR IT YOUR'LL HAVE TO SEE IF FOR YOUR SELF.

The copy (VHS) was poorly reproduced in that it was so dense that the night scenes were almost total darkness, showing only vaguely defined movement even though the sound was clear. I get better recordings off the air.

Scarecrow and Mrs. King was not an award winning drama show, but it was good fun for the whole family and is child friendly.  Mrs. King is an average homemaker and mother of two boys, who accidentally becomes involved with a spy (Scarecrow). She eventually becomes a real agent and always gets them into trouble. Btw, Bruce Boxleitner is a pleasure to look at!
